import requests
import bs4
import pandas as pd

# Function to scrape search engine results for a given query
def scrape_search_results(query):
    # Get the search results for the query
    results = requests.get("https://www.google.com/search?q=" + query)

    # Parse the HTML content of the results page
    soup = bs4. BeautifulSoup(results.text, "html.parser")

    # Create a Pandas DataFrame to store the results
    df = pd.DataFrame({"URL": [], "Title": [], "Content": []})

    # Iterate over the results
    for result in soup.find_all("div", class_="ZINbbc"):
        # Extract the URL, title, and content from each result
        url = result.find("a")["href"]
        title = result.find("h3").text
        content = result.find("div", class_="ZINbbc-sc-v").text

        # Add the data to the DataFrame
        df.loc[len(df)] = [url, title, content]

    # Return the DataFrame
    return df
